heading: Are Fish And Chips gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Fish And Chips and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: Fish and chips can pose a gluten risk primarily due to the batter used on the fish and the potential for cross-contamination in the frying process. Care should be taken to ensure that gluten-free options are properly prepared.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Fish And Chips can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

waiter_script.preview: Is the fish battered with gluten-free flour and cooked in a dedicated fryer?

safe_alternatives: Rice bowls with fish and vegetables

faq.question: Can BiteRight confirm if Fish And Chips are gluten free?
faq.answer: BiteRight highlights likely gluten risks based on ingredients and preparation. Always confirm with the kitchen if you have coeliac disease.

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
faq.answer: Ask about shared equipment, sauces, marinades, and whether the kitchen has a dedicated gluten-free prep area.
